abstract: Self-knowledge requires more than intellectual self-examination. It demands knowing something about your feelings.
snippet: Self-knowledge requires more than intellectual self-examination. It demands knowing something about your feelings.
lead_paragraph: Sigmund Freud, that seer of the psyche, taught that you could be angry and not know it. You can also be a philosopher and not know it. And Freud was just that, an unconscious philosopher of the unconscious - one who had nary a positive word to say about philosophy. Just listen to him grouse in 1933:
